  • Constructor Details

    • Problem

      public Problem​(int newSourceNr, int newDestNr, Source[] newSources, Destination[] newDest, int[][] newCosts)
      Parameters:
      newSourceNr - - the number of the sources
      newDestNr - - the number of the destinations
      newSources - - an array of Sources
      newDest - - an array of destinations
      newCosts - - the cost matrix, representing the cost to deliver an unit from a source to a specific destination.

  • Method Details

    • hasDuplicate

      public boolean hasDuplicate​(java.lang.Object[] objArray, java.lang.String type)
      Function used to determine if the @param objArray has any duplicates.
      Parameters:
      objArray - - the array of Sources or Destinations
      type - - is "S" or "D" depending on its type ( S for Sources, D for Destinations)
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is a duplicate in the array, false otherwise

    • getSolution

      public Solution getSolution()
      Return a solution only if the problem was already solved.
      Returns:
      Returns the solution if there is one, otherwise exits.

    • solveProblem

      public void solveProblem()
      In order to get a feasible solution, the Transportation Problem the Least Cost Method will be used. At every step the minimum cost of delivery will be chosen. In case that there is a tie, the cell where the maximum quantity can be delivered will be chosen. Repeat this process until the demand is satisfied.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Display the instance of the problem the way it is displayed in the example from the laboratory.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
